content:
Based on the execution logs, I'll generate a report summarizing the existing structures and error tips.

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Plate Production Facility
Consists of three stone furnaces in a production line:
- Furnace 1 at position (0.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 2 at position (2.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 3 at position (4.0, 4.0)
All furnaces are processing copper ore and using coal as fuel

### Copper Cable Production Line
Located around position (9.5, 11.5), consists of:
- Wooden chest at (6.5, 11.5) storing input materials
- Burner inserter at (7.5, 11.5) feeding materials
- Assembling machine at (9.5, 11.5) producing copper cables
- Output burner inserter at (11.5, 11.5)
- Output wooden chest at (12.5, 11.5)

### Storage Area
Series of wooden chests for material storage:
- Chest at (14.5, 11.5) storing iron plates (full)
- Chest at (16.5, 11.5) storing copper plates
- Chest at (12.5, 11.5) storing mixed materials (iron plates, copper plates, electronic circuits)

### Power Generation System
Located around position (-7.0, 24.5), consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) providing water
- Pipe network connecting water flow
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5)
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5)
- Electric pole network connecting power to facilities

### Science Pack Handling System
Located around position (0.5, 30.5), consists of:
- Storage chest at (0.5, 31.5) containing science packs
- Burner inserter at (0.5, 30.5) for automation

ERROR TIPS

### Resource Management Errors
- Monitor coal levels in inventory before attempting to insert into boiler or furnaces
- Keep track of fuel levels in burner inserters to maintain continuous operation

### Assembler Operation Errors
- Verify items are available in assembler before attempting extraction
- Ensure proper input materials are available before starting production cycles

### Space Management
- Clear blocked items from ground regularly to prevent inserter operation issues
- Ensure destination entities have space before attempting item transfers

### Inventory Management
- Monitor chest capacity to prevent overflow situations
- Keep sufficient coal supply for all fuel-consuming entities (burner inserters, furnaces, boiler)
